title: Blackletter similar to ITC's Blackmoor
content:
Possibly this is handlettered, but I swear I’ve seen it somewhere else too.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204456im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/knights_6220.jpg)

 [‹ Sauza Tequila logo italic/script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204456/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36506 "Go to previous forum topic") [\*\*\* IMPORTANT NOTICE -- Moderator recharging solar batteries \*\*\* ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204456/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36235 "Go to next forum topic")
author: seanglenn

comments.content:
My feeling is that this is actually a customization of Blackmoor. This is the only font that has some of these characteristic simplified Lombardic-inspired letters, especially this T. The H looks like two lines joining two I’s; the E and S seem like Blackmoor simplifications. The A and N are the most modified, and to me look similar to some of the letterforms in Aquitaine Initials, another Letraset font.

- Mike Yanega
